name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Of course you think there is nothing wrong, because you are not the one stranded there who wants to go home.
The daily armed police at the airport and train station are two different concepts. One is daily prevention, and the other is to directly use force to deter specific groups of people from rushing through the checkpoints. These are two different concepts.
To confuse such concepts is either stupid or bad.
The "if" is really funny. What if you climb over the wall to contact spies? So should we arrest you and interrogate you first?

content:
@SamHuang0 @hmk20301 Actually, the EU has solved all the concerns you mentioned. Now Amazon delivers goods in the EU the next day, people do not need visas to move around, and going to school is not a hassle.
But this is also the result of a thousand years of war between Europe. If one day China is divided into several countries, I think the civil war will last at least 30 years.
